playbook.name: Response to Phishing Email with Malicious Attachment Leading to Ransomware
playbook.description: This playbook addresses the detection, mitigation, and response to a phishing email with a malicious attachment that leads to ransomware encryption via malicious macro execution.

tactic.name: Initial Access
tactic.description: The adversary is attempting to gain entry to the network.

tactic.name: Execution
tactic.description: The adversary is trying to run malicious code.

tactic.name: Impact
tactic.description: The adversary aims to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy systems and data.

steps: Configure email gateway to filter out emails containing malicious indicators and attachments known to be used by attackers.
Regularly update the filtering criteria based on the latest threat intelligence.
Conduct regular training sessions for employees on recognizing phishing attempts and the importance of not opening suspicious attachments.
Implement a testing program to send simulated phishing emails and provide feedback and additional training to those who fall for the tests.
Configure endpoint protection platforms to block the execution of macros from untrusted sources.
Apply strict group policies to prevent macro execution in Microsoft Office files received via email.
Isolate infected systems from the network to prevent the spread of ransomware.
Disconnect affected devices from all network connections, both wired and wireless.
Restore affected systems from backups after ensuring the backups are free from ransomware.
Regularly test backup integrity and the restoration process.
Run updated anti-malware scans on affected and potentially affected systems to remove ransomware components.
Ensure continuous monitoring and updating of anti-malware solutions across the organization.

response.name: Incident Response
response.description: Actions to be taken post-identification of the phishing and ransomware attack.
steps: Notify the incident response team to initiate the response protocol.
Document the attack vector, payload, and scope of impact for further analysis and evidence.
Communicate with stakeholders about the breach while maintaining transparency about mitigation steps and recovery progress.
